text: XLII
text_tokenized: XLII

text: The Prices were just setting off for church the next day when Mr. Crawford appeared again .
text_tokenized: The Prices were just setting off for church the next day when Mr. Crawford appeared again .

text: He came , not to stop , but to join them ; he was asked to go with them to the Garrison chapel , which was exactly what he had intended , and they all walked thither together .
text_tokenized: He came , not to stop , but to join them ; he was asked to go with them to the Garrison chapel , which was exactly what he had intended , and they all walked thither together .

text: The family were now seen to advantage .
text_tokenized: The family were now seen to advantage .

text: Nature had given them no inconsiderable share of beauty , and every Sunday dressed them in their cleanest skins and best attire .
text_tokenized: Nature had given them no inconsiderable share of beauty , and every Sunday dressed them in their cleanest skins and best attire .

text: Sunday always brought this comfort to Fanny , and on this Sunday she felt it more than ever .
text_tokenized: Sunday always brought this comfort to Fanny , and on this Sunday she felt it more than ever .

text: Her poor mother now did not look so very unworthy of being Lady Bertram ’s sister as she was but too apt to look .
text_tokenized: Her poor mother now did not look so very unworthy of being Lady Bertram ’s sister as she was but too apt to look .

text: It often grieved her to the heart to think of the contrast between them ; to think that where nature had made so little difference , circumstances should have made so much , and that her mother , as handsome as Lady Bertram , and some years her junior , should have an appearance so much more worn and faded , so comfortless , so slatternly , so shabby .
text_tokenized: It often grieved her to the heart to think of the contrast between them ; to think that where nature had made so little difference , circumstances should have made so much , and that her mother , as handsome as Lady Bertram , and some years her junior , should have an appearance so much more worn and faded , so comfortless , so slatternly , so shabby .

text: But Sunday made her a very creditable and tolerably cheerful - looking Mrs. Price , coming abroad with a fine family of children , feeling a little respite of her weekly cares , and only discomposed if she saw her boys run into danger , or Rebecca pass by with a flower in her hat .
text_tokenized: But Sunday made her a very creditable and tolerably cheerful - looking Mrs. Price , coming abroad with a fine family of children , feeling a little respite of her weekly cares , and only discomposed if she saw her boys run into danger , or Rebecca pass by with a flower in her hat .

text: In chapel they were obliged to divide , but Mr. Crawford took care not to be divided from the female branch ; and after chapel he still continued with them , and made one in the family party on the ramparts .
text_tokenized: In chapel they were obliged to divide , but Mr. Crawford took care not to be divided from the female branch ; and after chapel he still continued with them , and made one in the family party on the ramparts .

text: Mrs. Price took her weekly walk on the ramparts every fine Sunday throughout the year , always going directly after morning service and staying till dinner - time .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Price took her weekly walk on the ramparts every fine Sunday throughout the year , always going directly after morning service and staying till dinner - time .

text: It was her public place : there she met her acquaintance , heard a little news , talked over the badness of the Portsmouth servants , and wound up her spirits for the six days ensuing .
text_tokenized: It was her public place : there she met her acquaintance , heard a little news , talked over the badness of the Portsmouth servants , and wound up her spirits for the six days ensuing .

text: Thither they now went ; Mr. Crawford most happy to consider the Miss Prices as his peculiar charge ; and before they had been there long , somehow or other , there was no saying how , Fanny could not have believed it , but he was walking between them with an arm of each under his , and she did not know how to prevent or put an end to it .
text_tokenized: Thither they now went ; Mr. Crawford most happy to consider the Miss Prices as his peculiar charge ; and before they had been there long , somehow or other , there was no saying how , Fanny could not have believed it , but he was walking between them with an arm of each under his , and she did not know how to prevent or put an end to it .

text: It made her uncomfortable for a time , but yet there were enjoyments in the day and in the view which would be felt .
text_tokenized: It made her uncomfortable for a time , but yet there were enjoyments in the day and in the view which would be felt .

text: The day was uncommonly lovely .
text_tokenized: The day was uncommonly lovely .

text: It was really March ; but it was April in its mild air , brisk soft wind , and bright sun , occasionally clouded for a minute ; and everything looked so beautiful under the influence of such a sky , the effects of the shadows pursuing each other on the ships at Spithead and the island beyond , with the ever - varying hues of the sea , now at high water , dancing in its glee and dashing against the ramparts with so fine a sound , produced altogether such a combination of charms for Fanny , as made her gradually almost careless of the circumstances under which she felt them . Nay , had she been without his arm , she would soon have known that she needed it , for she wanted strength for a two hours ’ saunter of this kind , coming , as it generally did , upon a week ’s previous inactivity .
text_tokenized: It was really March ; but it was April in its mild air , brisk soft wind , and bright sun , occasionally clouded for a minute ; and everything looked so beautiful under the influence of such a sky , the effects of the shadows pursuing each other on the ships at Spithead and the island beyond , with the ever - varying hues of the sea , now at high water , dancing in its glee and dashing against the ramparts with so fine a sound , produced altogether such a combination of charms for Fanny , as made her gradually almost careless of the circumstances under which she felt them . Nay , had she been without his arm , she would soon have known that she needed it , for she wanted strength for a two hours ’ saunter of this kind , coming , as it generally did , upon a week ’s previous inactivity .

text: Fanny was beginning to feel the effect of being debarred from her usual regular exercise ; she had lost ground as to health since her being in Portsmouth ; and but for Mr. Crawford and the beauty of the weather would soon have been knocked up now .
text_tokenized: Fanny was beginning to feel the effect of being debarred from her usual regular exercise ; she had lost ground as to health since her being in Portsmouth ; and but for Mr. Crawford and the beauty of the weather would soon have been knocked up now .

text: The loveliness of the day , and of the view , he felt like herself .
text_tokenized: The loveliness of the day , and of the view , he felt like herself .

text: They often stopt with the same sentiment and taste , leaning against the wall , some minutes , to look and admire ; and considering he was not Edmund , Fanny could not but allow that he was sufficiently open to the charms of nature , and very well able to express his admiration .
text_tokenized: They often stopt with the same sentiment and taste , leaning against the wall , some minutes , to look and admire ; and considering he was not Edmund , Fanny could not but allow that he was sufficiently open to the charms of nature , and very well able to express his admiration .

text: She had a few tender reveries now and then , which he could sometimes take advantage of to look in her face without detection ; and the result of these looks was , that though as bewitching as ever , her face was less blooming than it ought to be .
text_tokenized: She had a few tender reveries now and then , which he could sometimes take advantage of to look in her face without detection ; and the result of these looks was , that though as bewitching as ever , her face was less blooming than it ought to be .

text: She _ said _ she was very well , and did not like to be supposed otherwise ; but take it all in all , he was convinced that her present residence could not be comfortable , and therefore could not be salutary for her , and he was growing anxious for her being again at Mansfield , where her own happiness , and his in seeing her , must be so much greater .
text_tokenized: She _ said _ she was very well , and did not like to be supposed otherwise ; but take it all in all , he was convinced that her present residence could not be comfortable , and therefore could not be salutary for her , and he was growing anxious for her being again at Mansfield , where her own happiness , and his in seeing her , must be so much greater .

text: “ You have been here a month , I think ? ” said he .
text_tokenized: “ You have been here a month , I think ? ” said he .

text: “ No ; not quite a month .
text_tokenized: “ No ; not quite a month .

text: It is only four weeks to - morrow since I left Mansfield . ”
text_tokenized: It is only four weeks to - morrow since I left Mansfield . ”

text: “ You are a most accurate and honest reckoner .
text_tokenized: “ You are a most accurate and honest reckoner .

text: I should call that a month . ”
text_tokenized: I should call that a month . ”

text: “ I did not arrive here till Tuesday evening . ”
text_tokenized: “ I did not arrive here till Tuesday evening . ”

text: “ And it is to be a two months ’ visit , is not ? ”
text_tokenized: “ And it is to be a two months ’ visit , is not ? ”

text: “ Yes .
text_tokenized: “ Yes .

text: My uncle talked of two months .
text_tokenized: My uncle talked of two months .

text: I suppose it will not be less . ”
text_tokenized: I suppose it will not be less . ”

text: “ And how are you to be conveyed back again ?
text_tokenized: “ And how are you to be conveyed back again ?

text: Who comes for you ? ”
text_tokenized: Who comes for you ? ”

text: “ I do not know .
text_tokenized: “ I do not know .

text: I have heard nothing about it yet from my aunt .
text_tokenized: I have heard nothing about it yet from my aunt .

text: Perhaps I may be to stay longer .
text_tokenized: Perhaps I may be to stay longer .

text: It may not be convenient for me to be fetched exactly at the two months ’ end . ”
text_tokenized: It may not be convenient for me to be fetched exactly at the two months ’ end . ”

text: After a moment ’s reflection , Mr. Crawford replied , “ I know Mansfield , I know its way , I know its faults towards _ you _ .
text_tokenized: After a moment ’s reflection , Mr. Crawford replied , “ I know Mansfield , I know its way , I know its faults towards _ you _ .

text: I know the danger of your being so far forgotten , as to have your comforts give way to the imaginary convenience of any single being in the family .
text_tokenized: I know the danger of your being so far forgotten , as to have your comforts give way to the imaginary convenience of any single being in the family .

text: I am aware that you may be left here week after week , if Sir Thomas can not settle everything for coming himself , or sending your aunt ’s maid for you , without involving the slightest alteration of the arrangements which he may have laid down for the next quarter of a year .
text_tokenized: I am aware that you may be left here week after week , if Sir Thomas can not settle everything for coming himself , or sending your aunt ’s maid for you , without involving the slightest alteration of the arrangements which he may have laid down for the next quarter of a year .

text: This will not do .
text_tokenized: This will not do .

text: Two months is an ample allowance ; I should think six weeks quite enough .
text_tokenized: Two months is an ample allowance ; I should think six weeks quite enough .

text: I am considering your sister ’s health , ” said he , addressing himself to Susan , “ which I think the confinement of Portsmouth unfavourable to .
text_tokenized: I am considering your sister ’s health , ” said he , addressing himself to Susan , “ which I think the confinement of Portsmouth unfavourable to .

text: She requires constant air and exercise .
text_tokenized: She requires constant air and exercise .

text: When you know her as well as I do , I am sure you will agree that she does , and that she ought never to be long banished from the free air and liberty of the country .
text_tokenized: When you know her as well as I do , I am sure you will agree that she does , and that she ought never to be long banished from the free air and liberty of the country .

text: If , therefore ” ( turning again to Fanny ) , “ you find yourself growing unwell , and any difficulties arise about your returning to Mansfield , without waiting for the two months to be ended , _ that _ must not be regarded as of any consequence , if you feel yourself at all less strong or comfortable than usual , and will only let my sister know it , give her only the slightest hint , she and I will immediately come down , and take you back to Mansfield .
text_tokenized: If , therefore ” ( turning again to Fanny ) , “ you find yourself growing unwell , and any difficulties arise about your returning to Mansfield , without waiting for the two months to be ended , _ that _ must not be regarded as of any consequence , if you feel yourself at all less strong or comfortable than usual , and will only let my sister know it , give her only the slightest hint , she and I will immediately come down , and take you back to Mansfield .

text: You know the ease and the pleasure with which this would be done .
text_tokenized: You know the ease and the pleasure with which this would be done .

text: You know all that would be felt on the occasion . ”
text_tokenized: You know all that would be felt on the occasion . ”

text: Fanny thanked him , but tried to laugh it off .
text_tokenized: Fanny thanked him , but tried to laugh it off .

text: “ I am perfectly serious , ” he replied , “ as you perfectly know .
text_tokenized: “ I am perfectly serious , ” he replied , “ as you perfectly know .

text: And I hope you will not be cruelly concealing any tendency to indisposition .
text_tokenized: And I hope you will not be cruelly concealing any tendency to indisposition .

text: Indeed , you shall _ not _ ; it shall not be in your power ; for so long only as you positively say , in every letter to Mary , ‘ I am well , ’ and I know you can not speak or write a falsehood , so long only shall you be considered as well . ”
text_tokenized: Indeed , you shall _ not _ ; it shall not be in your power ; for so long only as you positively say , in every letter to Mary , ‘ I am well , ’ and I know you can not speak or write a falsehood , so long only shall you be considered as well . ”

text: Fanny thanked him again , but was affected and distressed to a degree that made it impossible for her to say much , or even to be certain of what she ought to say .
text_tokenized: Fanny thanked him again , but was affected and distressed to a degree that made it impossible for her to say much , or even to be certain of what she ought to say .

text: This was towards the close of their walk .
text_tokenized: This was towards the close of their walk .

text: He attended them to the last , and left them only at the door of their own house , when he knew them to be going to dinner , and therefore pretended to be waited for elsewhere .
text_tokenized: He attended them to the last , and left them only at the door of their own house , when he knew them to be going to dinner , and therefore pretended to be waited for elsewhere .

text: “ I wish you were not so tired , ” said he , still detaining Fanny after all the others were in the house—“I wish I left you in stronger health .
text_tokenized: “ I wish you were not so tired , ” said he , still detaining Fanny after all the others were in the house—“I wish I left you in stronger health .

text: Is there anything I can do for you in town ?
text_tokenized: Is there anything I can do for you in town ?

text: I have half an idea of going into Norfolk again soon .
text_tokenized: I have half an idea of going into Norfolk again soon .

text: I am not satisfied about Maddison .
text_tokenized: I am not satisfied about Maddison .

text: I am sure he still means to impose on me if possible , and get a cousin of his own into a certain mill , which I design for somebody else .
text_tokenized: I am sure he still means to impose on me if possible , and get a cousin of his own into a certain mill , which I design for somebody else .

text: I must come to an understanding with him .
text_tokenized: I must come to an understanding with him .

text: I must make him know that I will not be tricked on the south side of Everingham , any more than on the north : that I will be master of my own property .
text_tokenized: I must make him know that I will not be tricked on the south side of Everingham , any more than on the north : that I will be master of my own property .

text: I was not explicit enough with him before .
text_tokenized: I was not explicit enough with him before .

text: The mischief such a man does on an estate , both as to the credit of his employer and the welfare of the poor , is inconceivable .
text_tokenized: The mischief such a man does on an estate , both as to the credit of his employer and the welfare of the poor , is inconceivable .

text: I have a great mind to go back into Norfolk directly , and put everything at once on such a footing as can not be afterwards swerved from .
text_tokenized: I have a great mind to go back into Norfolk directly , and put everything at once on such a footing as can not be afterwards swerved from .

text: Maddison is a clever fellow ; I do not wish to displace him , provided he does not try to displace _ me _ ; but it would be simple to be duped by a man who has no right of creditor to dupe me , and worse
text_tokenized: Maddison is a clever fellow ; I do not wish to displace him , provided he does not try to displace _ me _ ; but it would be simple to be duped by a man who has no right of creditor to dupe me , and worse

text: than simple to let him give me a hard - hearted , griping fellow for a tenant , instead of an honest man , to whom I have given half a promise already .
text_tokenized: than simple to let him give me a hard - hearted , griping fellow for a tenant , instead of an honest man , to whom I have given half a promise already .

text: Would it not be worse than simple ?
text_tokenized: Would it not be worse than simple ?

text: Shall I go ?
text_tokenized: Shall I go ?

text: Do you advise it ?
text_tokenized: Do you advise it ?

text: “ I advise !
text_tokenized: “ I advise !

text: You know very well what is right . ” “ Yes .
text_tokenized: You know very well what is right . ” “ Yes .

text: When you give me your opinion , I always know what is right .
text_tokenized: When you give me your opinion , I always know what is right .

text: Your judgment is my rule of right . ”
text_tokenized: Your judgment is my rule of right . ”

text: “ Oh , no !
text_tokenized: “ Oh , no !

text: do not say so .
text_tokenized: do not say so .

text: We have all a better guide in ourselves , if we would attend to it , than any other person can be .
text_tokenized: We have all a better guide in ourselves , if we would attend to it , than any other person can be .

text: Good - bye ; I wish you a pleasant journey to - morrow .
text_tokenized: Good - bye ; I wish you a pleasant journey to - morrow .

text: “ Is there nothing I can do for you in town ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Is there nothing I can do for you in town ? ”

text: “ Nothing ; I am much obliged to you . ”
text_tokenized: “ Nothing ; I am much obliged to you . ”

text: “ Have you no message for anybody ? ” “ My love to your sister , if you please ; and when you see my cousin , my cousin Edmund , I wish you would be so good as to say that I suppose I shall soon hear from him . ” “ Certainly ; and if he is lazy or negligent , I will write his excuses myself . ” He could say no more , for Fanny would be no longer detained .
text_tokenized: “ Have you no message for anybody ? ” “ My love to your sister , if you please ; and when you see my cousin , my cousin Edmund , I wish you would be so good as to say that I suppose I shall soon hear from him . ” “ Certainly ; and if he is lazy or negligent , I will write his excuses myself . ” He could say no more , for Fanny would be no longer detained .

text: He pressed her hand , looked at her , and was gone .
text_tokenized: He pressed her hand , looked at her , and was gone .

text: He _ went to while away the next three hours as he could , with his other acquaintance , till the best dinner that a capital inn afforded was ready for their enjoyment , and _ she _ turned in to her more simple one immediately .
text_tokenized: He _ went to while away the next three hours as he could , with his other acquaintance , till the best dinner that a capital inn afforded was ready for their enjoyment , and _ she _ turned in to her more simple one immediately .

text: Their general fare bore a very different character ; and could he have suspected how many privations , besides that of exercise , she endured in her father ’s house , he would have wondered that her looks were not much more affected than he found them .
text_tokenized: Their general fare bore a very different character ; and could he have suspected how many privations , besides that of exercise , she endured in her father ’s house , he would have wondered that her looks were not much more affected than he found them .

text: She was so little equal to Rebecca ’s puddings and Rebecca ’s hashes , brought to table , as they all were , with such accompaniments of half - cleaned plates , and not half - cleaned knives and forks , that she was very often constrained to defer her heartiest meal till she could send her brothers in the evening for biscuits and buns .
text_tokenized: She was so little equal to Rebecca ’s puddings and Rebecca ’s hashes , brought to table , as they all were , with such accompaniments of half - cleaned plates , and not half - cleaned knives and forks , that she was very often constrained to defer her heartiest meal till she could send her brothers in the evening for biscuits and buns .

text: After being nursed up at Mansfield , it was too late in the day to be hardened at Portsmouth ; and though Sir Thomas , had he known all , might have thought his niece in the most promising way of being starved , both mind and body , into a much juster value for Mr. Crawford ’s good company and good fortune , he would probably have feared to push his experiment farther , lest she might die under the cure . Fanny was out of spirits all the rest of the day .
text_tokenized: After being nursed up at Mansfield , it was too late in the day to be hardened at Portsmouth ; and though Sir Thomas , had he known all , might have thought his niece in the most promising way of being starved , both mind and body , into a much juster value for Mr. Crawford ’s good company and good fortune , he would probably have feared to push his experiment farther , lest she might die under the cure . Fanny was out of spirits all the rest of the day .

text: Though tolerably secure of not seeing Mr. Crawford again , she could not help being low .
text_tokenized: Though tolerably secure of not seeing Mr. Crawford again , she could not help being low .

text: It was parting with somebody of the nature of a friend ; and though , in one light , glad to have him gone , it seemed as if she was now deserted by everybody ; it was a sort of renewed separation from Mansfield ; and she could not think of his returning to town , and being frequently with Mary and Edmund , without feelings so near akin to envy as made her hate herself for having them .
text_tokenized: It was parting with somebody of the nature of a friend ; and though , in one light , glad to have him gone , it seemed as if she was now deserted by everybody ; it was a sort of renewed separation from Mansfield ; and she could not think of his returning to town , and being frequently with Mary and Edmund , without feelings so near akin to envy as made her hate herself for having them .

text: Her dejection had no abatement from anything passing around her ;
text_tokenized: Her dejection had no abatement from anything passing around her ;

text: a friend or two of her father ’s , as always happened if he was not with them , spent the long , long evening there ; and from six o’clock till half - past nine , there was little intermission of noise or grog .
text_tokenized: a friend or two of her father ’s , as always happened if he was not with them , spent the long , long evening there ; and from six o’clock till half - past nine , there was little intermission of noise or grog .

text: She was very low .
text_tokenized: She was very low .

text: The wonderful improvement which she still fancied in Mr. Crawford was the nearest to administering comfort of anything within the current of her thoughts .
text_tokenized: The wonderful improvement which she still fancied in Mr. Crawford was the nearest to administering comfort of anything within the current of her thoughts .

text: Not considering in how different a circle she had been just seeing him , nor how much might be owing to contrast , she was quite persuaded of his being astonishingly more gentle and regardful of others than formerly .
text_tokenized: Not considering in how different a circle she had been just seeing him , nor how much might be owing to contrast , she was quite persuaded of his being astonishingly more gentle and regardful of others than formerly .

text: And , if in little things , must it not be so in great ?
text_tokenized: And , if in little things , must it not be so in great ?

text: So anxious for her health and comfort , so very feeling as he now expressed himself , and really seemed , might not it be fairly supposed that he would not much longer persevere in a suit so distressing to her ?
text_tokenized: So anxious for her health and comfort , so very feeling as he now expressed himself , and really seemed , might not it be fairly supposed that he would not much longer persevere in a suit so distressing to her ?

text: XLIII It was presumed that Mr. Crawford was travelling back , to London , on the morrow , for nothing more was seen of him at Mr. Price ’s ; and two days afterwards , it was a fact ascertained to Fanny by the following letter from his sister , opened and read by her , on another account , with the most anxious curiosity :
text_tokenized: XLIII It was presumed that Mr. Crawford was travelling back , to London , on the morrow , for nothing more was seen of him at Mr. Price ’s ; and two days afterwards , it was a fact ascertained to Fanny by the following letter from his sister , opened and read by her , on another account , with the most anxious curiosity :

text: — “ I have to inform you , my dearest Fanny , that Henry has been down to Portsmouth to see you ; that he had a delightful walk with you to the dockyard last Saturday , and one still more to be dwelt on the next day , on the ramparts ; when the balmy air , the sparkling sea , and your sweet looks and conversation were altogether in the most delicious harmony , and afforded sensations which are to raise ecstasy even in retrospect .
text_tokenized: — “ I have to inform you , my dearest Fanny , that Henry has been down to Portsmouth to see you ; that he had a delightful walk with you to the dockyard last Saturday , and one still more to be dwelt on the next day , on the ramparts ; when the balmy air , the sparkling sea , and your sweet looks and conversation were altogether in the most delicious harmony , and afforded sensations which are to raise ecstasy even in retrospect .

text: This , as well as I understand , is to be the substance of my information .
text_tokenized: This , as well as I understand , is to be the substance of my information .

text: He makes me write , but I do not know what else is to be communicated , except this said visit to Portsmouth , and these two said walks , and his introduction to your family , especially to a fair sister of yours , a fine girl of fifteen , who was of the party on the ramparts , taking her first lesson , I presume , in love .
text_tokenized: He makes me write , but I do not know what else is to be communicated , except this said visit to Portsmouth , and these two said walks , and his introduction to your family , especially to a fair sister of yours , a fine girl of fifteen , who was of the party on the ramparts , taking her first lesson , I presume , in love .

text: I have not time for writing much , but it would be out of place if I had , for this is to be a mere letter of business , penned for the purpose of conveying necessary information , which could not be delayed without risk of evil .
text_tokenized: I have not time for writing much , but it would be out of place if I had , for this is to be a mere letter of business , penned for the purpose of conveying necessary information , which could not be delayed without risk of evil .

text: My dear , dear Fanny , if I had you here , how I would talk to you !
text_tokenized: My dear , dear Fanny , if I had you here , how I would talk to you !

text: You should listen to me till you were tired , and advise me till you were still tired more ; but it is impossible to put a hundredth part of my great mind on paper , so I will abstain altogether , and leave you to guess what you like .
text_tokenized: You should listen to me till you were tired , and advise me till you were still tired more ; but it is impossible to put a hundredth part of my great mind on paper , so I will abstain altogether , and leave you to guess what you like .

text: I have no news for you .
text_tokenized: I have no news for you .

text: You have politics , of course ; and it would be too bad to plague you with the names of people and parties that fill up my time .
text_tokenized: You have politics , of course ; and it would be too bad to plague you with the names of people and parties that fill up my time .

text: I ought to have sent you an account of your cousin ’s first party , but I was lazy , and now it is too long
text_tokenized: I ought to have sent you an account of your cousin ’s first party , but I was lazy , and now it is too long

text: ago
text_tokenized: ago

text: ; suffice it , that everything was just as it ought to be , in a style that any of her connexions must have been gratified to witness , and that her own dress and manners did her the greatest credit . My friend , Mrs. Fraser , is mad for such a house , and it would not make _ me _ miserable . I go to Lady Stornaway after Easter ; she seems in high spirits , and very happy .
text_tokenized: ; suffice it , that everything was just as it ought to be , in a style that any of her connexions must have been gratified to witness , and that her own dress and manners did her the greatest credit . My friend , Mrs. Fraser , is mad for such a house , and it would not make _ me _ miserable . I go to Lady Stornaway after Easter ; she seems in high spirits , and very happy .

text: I fancy Lord S. is very good - humoured and pleasant in his own family , and I do not think him so very ill - looking as I did — at least , one sees many worse .
text_tokenized: I fancy Lord S. is very good - humoured and pleasant in his own family , and I do not think him so very ill - looking as I did — at least , one sees many worse .

text: He will not do by the side of your cousin Edmund .
text_tokenized: He will not do by the side of your cousin Edmund .

text: Of the last - mentioned hero , what shall I say ?
text_tokenized: Of the last - mentioned hero , what shall I say ?

text: If I avoided his name entirely , it would look suspicious .
text_tokenized: If I avoided his name entirely , it would look suspicious .

text: I will say , then , that we have seen him two or three times , and that my friends here are very much struck with his gentlemanlike appearance .
text_tokenized: I will say , then , that we have seen him two or three times , and that my friends here are very much struck with his gentlemanlike appearance .

text: Mrs. Fraser ( no bad judge ) declares she knows but three men in town who have so good a person , height , and air ; and I must confess , when he dined here the other day , there were none to compare with him , and we were a party of sixteen .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Fraser ( no bad judge ) declares she knows but three men in town who have so good a person , height , and air ; and I must confess , when he dined here the other day , there were none to compare with him , and we were a party of sixteen .

text: Luckily there is no distinction of dress nowadays to tell tales , but — but — but Yours affectionately . ”
text_tokenized: Luckily there is no distinction of dress nowadays to tell tales , but — but — but Yours affectionately . ”

text: “ I had almost forgot ( it was Edmund ’s fault : he gets into my head more than does me good ) one very material thing I had to say from Henry and myself — I mean about our taking you back into Northamptonshire .
text_tokenized: “ I had almost forgot ( it was Edmund ’s fault : he gets into my head more than does me good ) one very material thing I had to say from Henry and myself — I mean about our taking you back into Northamptonshire .

text: My dear little creature , do not stay at Portsmouth to lose your pretty looks .
text_tokenized: My dear little creature , do not stay at Portsmouth to lose your pretty looks .

text: Those vile sea - breezes are the ruin of beauty and health .
text_tokenized: Those vile sea - breezes are the ruin of beauty and health .

text: My poor aunt always felt affected if within ten miles of the sea , which the Admiral of course never believed , but I know it was so .
text_tokenized: My poor aunt always felt affected if within ten miles of the sea , which the Admiral of course never believed , but I know it was so .

text: I am at your service and Henry ’s , at an hour ’s notice .
text_tokenized: I am at your service and Henry ’s , at an hour ’s notice .

text: I should like the scheme , and we would make a little circuit , and shew you Everingham in our way , and perhaps you would not mind passing through London , and seeing the inside of St. George ’s , Hanover Square .
text_tokenized: I should like the scheme , and we would make a little circuit , and shew you Everingham in our way , and perhaps you would not mind passing through London , and seeing the inside of St. George ’s , Hanover Square .

text: Only keep your cousin Edmund from me at such a time : I should not like to be tempted .
text_tokenized: Only keep your cousin Edmund from me at such a time : I should not like to be tempted .

text: What a long letter !
text_tokenized: What a long letter !

text: one word more .
text_tokenized: one word more .

text: Henry , I find , has some idea of going into Norfolk again upon some business that _ you _ approve ; but this can not possibly be permitted before the middle of next week ; that is , he can not anyhow be spared till after the 14th , for _ we _ have a party that evening .
text_tokenized: Henry , I find , has some idea of going into Norfolk again upon some business that _ you _ approve ; but this can not possibly be permitted before the middle of next week ; that is , he can not anyhow be spared till after the 14th , for _ we _ have a party that evening .

text: The value of a man like Henry , on such an occasion , is what you can have no conception of ; so you must take it upon my word to be inestimable .
text_tokenized: The value of a man like Henry , on such an occasion , is what you can have no conception of ; so you must take it upon my word to be inestimable .

text: He will see the Rushworths , which I own I am not sorry for — having a little curiosity , and so I think has he — though he will not acknowledge it .
text_tokenized: He will see the Rushworths , which I own I am not sorry for — having a little curiosity , and so I think has he — though he will not acknowledge it .

text: This was a letter to be run through eagerly , to be read deliberately , to supply matter for much reflection , and to leave everything in greater suspense than ever .
text_tokenized: This was a letter to be run through eagerly , to be read deliberately , to supply matter for much reflection , and to leave everything in greater suspense than ever .

text: The only certainty to be drawn from it was , that nothing decisive had yet taken place .
text_tokenized: The only certainty to be drawn from it was , that nothing decisive had yet taken place .

text: Edmund had not yet spoken .
text_tokenized: Edmund had not yet spoken .

text: How Miss Crawford really felt , how she meant to act , or might act without or against her meaning ; whether his importance to her were quite what it had been before the last separation ; whether , if lessened , it were likely to lessen more , or to recover itself , were subjects for endless conjecture , and to be thought of on that day and many days to come , without producing any conclusion .
text_tokenized: How Miss Crawford really felt , how she meant to act , or might act without or against her meaning ; whether his importance to her were quite what it had been before the last separation ; whether , if lessened , it were likely to lessen more , or to recover itself , were subjects for endless conjecture , and to be thought of on that day and many days to come , without producing any conclusion .

text: The idea that returned the oftenest was that Miss Crawford , after proving herself cooled and staggered by a return to London habits , would yet prove herself in the end too much attached to him to give him up .
text_tokenized: The idea that returned the oftenest was that Miss Crawford , after proving herself cooled and staggered by a return to London habits , would yet prove herself in the end too much attached to him to give him up .

text: She would try to be more ambitious than her heart would allow .
text_tokenized: She would try to be more ambitious than her heart would allow .

text: She would hesitate , she would tease , she would condition , she would require a great deal , but she would finally accept .
text_tokenized: She would hesitate , she would tease , she would condition , she would require a great deal , but she would finally accept .

text: This was Fanny ’s most frequent expectation .
text_tokenized: This was Fanny ’s most frequent expectation .

text: A house in town — that , she thought , must be impossible .
text_tokenized: A house in town — that , she thought , must be impossible .

text: Yet there was no saying what Miss Crawford might not ask .
text_tokenized: Yet there was no saying what Miss Crawford might not ask .

text: The prospect for her cousin grew worse and worse .
text_tokenized: The prospect for her cousin grew worse and worse .

text: The woman who could speak of him , and speak only of his appearance !
text_tokenized: The woman who could speak of him , and speak only of his appearance !

text: What an unworthy attachment !
text_tokenized: What an unworthy attachment !

text: To be deriving support from the commendations of Mrs. Fraser !
text_tokenized: To be deriving support from the commendations of Mrs. Fraser !

text: _ She _ who had known him intimately half a year
text_tokenized: _ She _ who had known him intimately half a year

text: Fanny was ashamed of her .
text_tokenized: Fanny was ashamed of her .

text: Those parts of the letter which related only to Mr. Crawford and herself , touched her , in comparison , slightly .
text_tokenized: Those parts of the letter which related only to Mr. Crawford and herself , touched her , in comparison , slightly .

text: Whether Mr. Crawford went into Norfolk before or after the 14th was certainly no concern of hers , though , everything considered , she thought he _ would _ go without delay .
text_tokenized: Whether Mr. Crawford went into Norfolk before or after the 14th was certainly no concern of hers , though , everything considered , she thought he _ would _ go without delay .

text: That Miss Crawford should endeavour to secure a meeting between him and Mrs. Rushworth , was all in her worst line of conduct , and grossly unkind and ill - judged ; but she hoped _ he _ would not be actuated by any such degrading curiosity .
text_tokenized: That Miss Crawford should endeavour to secure a meeting between him and Mrs. Rushworth , was all in her worst line of conduct , and grossly unkind and ill - judged ; but she hoped _ he _ would not be actuated by any such degrading curiosity .

text: He acknowledged no such inducement , and his sister ought to have given him credit for better feelings than her own .
text_tokenized: He acknowledged no such inducement , and his sister ought to have given him credit for better feelings than her own .

text: She was yet more impatient for another letter from town after receiving this than she had been before ; and for a few days was so unsettled by it altogether , by what had come , and what might come , that her usual readings and conversation with Susan were much suspended . She could not
text_tokenized: She was yet more impatient for another letter from town after receiving this than she had been before ; and for a few days was so unsettled by it altogether , by what had come , and what might come , that her usual readings and conversation with Susan were much suspended . She could not

text: command her attention as she wished .
text_tokenized: command her attention as she wished .

text: If Mr. Crawford remembered her message to her cousin , she thought it very likely , most likely , that he would write to her at all events ; it would be most consistent with his usual kindness ; and till she got rid of this idea , till it gradually wore off , by no letters appearing in the course of three or four days more , she was in a most restless , anxious state .
text_tokenized: If Mr. Crawford remembered her message to her cousin , she thought it very likely , most likely , that he would write to her at all events ; it would be most consistent with his usual kindness ; and till she got rid of this idea , till it gradually wore off , by no letters appearing in the course of three or four days more , she was in a most restless , anxious state .

text: At length , a something like composure succeeded .
text_tokenized: At length , a something like composure succeeded .

text: Suspense must be submitted to , and must not be allowed to wear her out , and make her useless .
text_tokenized: Suspense must be submitted to , and must not be allowed to wear her out , and make her useless .

text: Time did something , her own exertions something more , and she resumed her attentions to Susan , and again awakened the same interest in them .
text_tokenized: Time did something , her own exertions something more , and she resumed her attentions to Susan , and again awakened the same interest in them .

text: Susan was growing very fond of her , and though without any of the early delight in books which had been so strong in Fanny , with a disposition much less inclined to sedentary pursuits , or to information for information ’s sake , she had so strong a desire of not _ appearing _ ignorant , as , with a good clear understanding , made her a most attentive , profitable , thankful pupil .
text_tokenized: Susan was growing very fond of her , and though without any of the early delight in books which had been so strong in Fanny , with a disposition much less inclined to sedentary pursuits , or to information for information ’s sake , she had so strong a desire of not _ appearing _ ignorant , as , with a good clear understanding , made her a most attentive , profitable , thankful pupil .

text: Fanny was her oracle .
text_tokenized: Fanny was her oracle .

text: Fanny ’s explanations and remarks were a most important addition to every essay , or every chapter of history .
text_tokenized: Fanny ’s explanations and remarks were a most important addition to every essay , or every chapter of history .

text: What Fanny told her of former times dwelt more on her mind than the pages of Goldsmith ; and she paid her sister the compliment of preferring her style to that of any printed author .
text_tokenized: What Fanny told her of former times dwelt more on her mind than the pages of Goldsmith ; and she paid her sister the compliment of preferring her style to that of any printed author .

text: The early habit of reading was wanting .
text_tokenized: The early habit of reading was wanting .

text: Their conversations , however , were not always on subjects so high as history or morals .
text_tokenized: Their conversations , however , were not always on subjects so high as history or morals .

text: Others had their hour ; and of lesser matters , none returned so often , or remained so long between them , as Mansfield Park , a description of the people , the manners , the amusements , the ways of Mansfield Park .
text_tokenized: Others had their hour ; and of lesser matters , none returned so often , or remained so long between them , as Mansfield Park , a description of the people , the manners , the amusements , the ways of Mansfield Park .

text: Susan , who had an innate taste for the genteel and well - appointed , was eager to hear , and Fanny could not but indulge herself in dwelling on so beloved a theme .
text_tokenized: Susan , who had an innate taste for the genteel and well - appointed , was eager to hear , and Fanny could not but indulge herself in dwelling on so beloved a theme .

text: She hoped it was not wrong ; though , after a time , Susan ’s very great admiration of everything said or done in her uncle ’s house , and earnest longing to go into Northamptonshire , seemed almost to blame her for exciting feelings which could not be gratified . Poor Susan was very little better fitted for home than her elder sister ; and as Fanny grew thoroughly to understand this , she began to feel that when her own release from Portsmouth came , her happiness would have a material drawback in leaving Susan behind .
text_tokenized: She hoped it was not wrong ; though , after a time , Susan ’s very great admiration of everything said or done in her uncle ’s house , and earnest longing to go into Northamptonshire , seemed almost to blame her for exciting feelings which could not be gratified . Poor Susan was very little better fitted for home than her elder sister ; and as Fanny grew thoroughly to understand this , she began to feel that when her own release from Portsmouth came , her happiness would have a material drawback in leaving Susan behind .

text: That a girl so capable of being made everything good should be left in such hands , distressed her more and more .
text_tokenized: That a girl so capable of being made everything good should be left in such hands , distressed her more and more .

text: Were _ she _ likely to have a home to invite her to , what a blessing it would be !
text_tokenized: Were _ she _ likely to have a home to invite her to , what a blessing it would be !

text: And had it been possible for her to return Mr. Crawford ’s regard , the probability of his being very far from objecting to such a measure would have been the greatest increase of all her own comforts .
text_tokenized: And had it been possible for her to return Mr. Crawford ’s regard , the probability of his being very far from objecting to such a measure would have been the greatest increase of all her own comforts .

text: She thought he was really good - tempered , and could fancy his entering into a plan of that sort most pleasantly .
text_tokenized: She thought he was really good - tempered , and could fancy his entering into a plan of that sort most pleasantly .
